title: Emmerdale's Sammy Winward teams up with Hollyoaks' Jamie Lomas for charity short film Lead Belly — which features his and Kym Marsh's daughter
text:
(Picture: Natalie Kennedy)

Hollyoaks’ Jamie Lomas is teaming up with Emmerdale star Sammy Winward for a special charity short film.

Lead Belly is inspired by actual events, and centres around homeless ex-soldier Mark, who is haunted by memories of a brutal event from his time in Afghanistan, which causes those around him chaos as he attempts to battle his inner demons.

The project focuses on themes such as homelessness and our armed forces, as well as hard-hitting topics such as mental health issues in veterans. The film’s aim is to raise awareness for homeless veterans.

Written by Ian Armer and Amanda Webster, Lead Belly is directed by Sean Glynn — who has previously won a British Soap award.

I really need your help! We are making a film to raise awareness for some amazing charities . Support our ex veterans who are suffering with mental health issues and some who are living on the streets. Please help by sharing and donating If you can https://t.co/S3hF5PGGLf pic.twitter.com/N3NxW71cTq — Jamie Lomas (@jamielomas1) October 4, 2019

Sammy and Jamie lead the cast, but they’re not the only soap stars to feature in the film, as Emmerdale’s Anthony Quinlan — who plays Pete Barton on the ITV soap — also makes an appearance, as does Jacob Roberts, who portrays Damon Kinsella on Hollyoaks.

In addition to this, Jamie Lomas and Kym Marsh’s daughter, Polly also features in the project.

(Picture: Kenneth James/Natalie Kennedy)

Director Sean Healey said: ‘This is a story that’s vital we tell. When I learned the statistics of how many veterans are living in the streets, dealing with mental health issues I was compelled to be a part of raising awareness for this cause.’

Filming on the project started this month in and around Manchester and Liverpool, and is set to wrap up on October 12th.

The filming is being crowdfunded.
